reviews.review_msg: she is SOOOO awesome. we have a website specifically for asking questions and she would never leave one question to the next day. her answers are greatly helpful and she is patient with all kinds of questions. class is amazing we all love it. she is an elegant lady and a charming prof. one of the best profs ive ever met.
Great professor but really makes you work for a good mark. Prepare to practice IPA symbols and syntax trees until you've drilled them into your brain device

Lectures are essential! Lectures are recorded and slides are posted.  Cliff is very informative and interesting, but his assessment is difficult.  Helpful to have a good TA, but you can also see Cliff for help too.
very helpful prof，clear contents during the lecture，however the final is hard.
NEVER take his course. Teach 3xx level stuff in 2xx courses. tut madatory or receive -1 point. Mid-term extremely hard. Cant imagine how hard the final would be!
midterm is very hard. not recommend. every wek has assignment need to due and ppl who didnt do or complete the assignment will deduct 1% of participation mark. never take his class
Have no interest in discussing about the doubtful grading mistakes, grading system is kinda unfair.

He is passionate about what he is teaching. Tutorials r useful. But his course is wayyyyyyyyy to hard. He assumes that Everyone loves linguistics as much as he does. Wake up! That is not possible.he is good, i personally like him. But i won't recommand my firends to take his course.unless you really llloooovveee linguistics.

Excellent prof. Straightforward, clear, and obviously interested in what he is teaching, but this course is VERY challenging. Between lectures and the textbook you should have a good understanding of the material but expect the exams to still be difficult. TA Rima's tutorials were not especially useful but the exercises required were.
His lectures are pretty interesting, however his exams are really hard.  Be VERY prepared and study hard... otherwise, avoid this class.
well... Just don't be sad guys... Linguistics is not as easy as you think...

Although he is a nice guy, he expects too much from us. We take this course as electives, and I do not think anyone is going to major in linguistic in our class. He scaled the mid term and assignment 1, but its still not good enough. Since the tests and assign are hard. The class average is C and he just said that to us today in class.

I just hope that he scales the entire class because I'm not prepared to get anything below a B. I tried hard in this class, really hard. He's a great guy and I have hopes he won't let us down.. he has already scaled the midterm.

hard exams and hard assignments. Linguistic 220 is considered as the easiest elective..but do not think so for this one..probably do not take it with this prof...the class average overall is C+ after scaling. The other prof has the average around B...

The problem with Cliff is that he gives us really easy examples in the lecture and textbook, which are not helpful for his assignments and exams. The questions he gives are ambiguous, difficult, and he may use words we've never seen before. I heard everyone saying how easy Ling 220 is, but just don't see how it can be true.

Extremely hard midterm exam. Assignments are worth 15% each, and they are tricky, have only one week to finish. Class average for the midterm was 52% (before scaling).. overall class Average is around C+. Very pathetic, considering that this should be one of the easiest elective courses.

dr. burgess is a really responsible prof. he expects you to work hard, because he puts the same amount of time in terms of preparing for each class. his exams are fairly harder compare to exercises on the text book. he spends extra time going over problems with his students, very rare to find a prof. like that=)
Very entertaining to listen to.

Tries to be funny in class.It helps to keep you awake at 830 in the morning. Helpful ONLY when it's not near an assignment... he won't say anything (nothing close) about anything on the assignment.If you study and read in advance, then you should do ok.
he gives you notes but very confusing if you don't know what you are doing. Assignment are HARD, exams are average.
notes are understandable and easy to grasp but the tests and assignments are a whole different issue

nice prof, explains stuff quite well, knows his stuff, very enthusiastic, tries to entertain the students, but not very good at it.  Makes hard tests though, but easy if you study and go to lectures and pay attention. don't take his class if u want marks.
The lecture is okay and so are his notes, but then again his exams and assignments are hard.  Nice guy though.
He made the easy stuff HARD!!!!
Not an easy course, good prof but is just very hard
very hard prof. he tries to be funny
I think he's hard, but then again I am a slacker.
No Comments

grading outline was good but it was altered slightly due to TA strike. Dr.Wong is a nice person but she seems to be a bit disorganized/unclear in her assignment instructions sometimes so make sure to ask for clarification! overall i enjoyed this class and would recommend going to tutorial for easy marks and help! tests were very fair as well :)

This is an online course taught from a textbook and a supplemental textbook. For an intro class it is a lot of info you need to learn. To have success I would suggest taking other Ling intro (100) classes if you are worried about getting a high mark. I was not able to take in that much information and was confused the whole semester.

Trevor was a great professor. What stood out the most was his ability to teach the content in a simple way that helps you to have a good understanding. To get the most out of the course you just have to watch or go to the lectures and pay attention, the rest should come fairly easy. His clear explanations helped me learn a lot from this class.

CS student here. Trevor is the most accommodating prof I've met (and will ever meet probably). The material requires practice/memorization, but there's more than enough info to study from: lectures, tutorials, weekly quizzes, assignments, and additional Qs. No exam. All resources provided online. Highly recommend as an interesting elective for CS.

I love Trevor. Im not a ling major, but he made this course fun and interesting. he was the most attentive and understanding prof I have ever had. tests were based off his lecture slides and contained only the information we needed to know, which made studying and understanding the concepts SO much easier. I recommend taking a course with him 100%

Really awesome prof! Really love the honest advice he gives for students and makes sure that his students understand the material. Always takes care of his students by making sure to not give too much work. Also love all the extra practice he gives us. Would totally recommend to take any Ling courses with him if possible!

I took this course with Dr Mellow and Trevor was my ta. I learned the whole course from tutorials because he could tell us the content properly. He is very nice and will spend lots of time with you if you need help. Its nice to be treated like a human at sfu and feel like someone genuinely cares about us.

Trevor was teaching assistent for Dr. Heift but he is the best teaching assistent I ever had. He always explain everything very good and came up with many example until I understood it. He is very smart but he never act better than us. He said we all could be smarter than him with enough practice. He should teach lots of courses!!

Love this prof. Had her in Fall2019 for LING100, and I loved her so much it's the only reason why I took 220. She does weekly quizzes (open book) and a participation question to make sure you don't fall behind (drop's lowest mark for each). Also, weekly homework marked by completion. She is extremely accessible, and answers questions quickly online
The best prof I've ever had! Her lectures show how passionate she is about what she teaches and she makes it easier for students to learn with easy weekly exercises in and out of class!

Shes really passionate about linguistics and had a great TA who was too. The lectures were difficult but they were always there to help. I could have skipped every week but she was very entertaining (and really cute I have a crush). Exams are fair but the final had some really hard multiple choice questions. Course was lit.

Maybe the best prof at SFU. She would remember almost every student in a big lecture! She'd even ask how you're finding things etc. She truly cares if you understand and do well (even if you weren't a great student she'd remember you and care). Somehow made a big lecture feel like a small one, not to mention she *really* knows her stuff

Trude is very to the point but very approachable and helpful when you ask for it. It's easy to get the participation and homework marks if you just do it and show up to class. The exams weren't super difficult but were weighted very heavily.

Such a great prof! This course isn't easy and there is a lot of material to learn, but she is fantastic at teaching and really cares that everyone understands. Midterm and final are not easy, but if you attend lectures and do the readings you will be fine. I hope I will have an opportunity to take another class with her!

Trude is a good lecturer. She is very knowledgeable and tries really hard to make sure we understand the material. TAs were also very nice and they answered questions very very quickly on canvas. The final though was BRUTAL. I have had MATH and MACM finals that were easier!!!!!
Super clear. Super helpful. Good speaker. Awesome all around :)

One of my favourite profs at SFU. She is very knowledgeable and cares that you understand the material, but she is not an easy prof. This course may challenge you, but as long as you read the textbook and attend lectures you should do well. She's quite entertaining and has a good sense of humour as well.
Rude to students, super condescending just because people don't like to do public speaking

What is there to say? She is fantastic. Best prof I've ever had. Cares about the students and gives useful feedback while ensuring you get your stuff done. She is also extremely knowledgeable  in SLA. I think she is German. True gem, this woman.
Extremely nice prof. Attend every lecture, though it can get quite boring. Study her notes like crazy, and you'll get an A for sure.
she's nice & awesome. the class is easy at the beginning, the later the more interesting. It's absolutely worth it if you do your assignment and ask questions you'll be all right :)

Trudy is f*ing awesome, my buddy recommended her as an elective credit and it was totally worth it. Pretty easy at the beginning and decently interesting. The book is alright, and the assignments are cake. I had her as my TA and she was very helpful; she can come across as stern but she is really a sweetheart.
super nice prof!!!And the course wasnt that hard!!good notes!!

best prof ever =) I would take any class she taught, regardless of whether or not i was interested in the subject, just because she was teaching it. Very good at explaining concepts, and also very patient when answering questions.

WOW. BEST LING PROF EVVVER. the way she teaches is very engaging. you will NEVER be bored in class. crystal clear voice. VERY helpful. nice and best of all she doesn't surprise you on the exams. one question is..why isn't she teaching other ling courses? what a waste. seriously. LOVEEE HERRR and she's funny.

One of the best profs for linguistics department.  She teaches really well in class, allowing you to be able to understand EVERYTHING just by paying attention in class.  Midterm and final were both really easy, just know everything on the study guide, and you're bound to get an A- or higher.  Assignments are a bit trickier, but not hard!  Good prof

Amazing prof! So clear, makes class really, really pleasant, makes you actually want to attend. Gives a summary of previous class before class, this is very helpful! She knows her stuiff and loves it. If you can TAKE THIS CLASS. Even as an elective. Do it.
she's very nice and helpful. do the assignments yourself, study the study guide and you'll do fine.
She is the fairest prof ever.  She is remarkable!  Pay attention to the study guides and you'll do fine!
No Comments
Content is hard but the professor repeats a lot which helped me to understand. The assignments were also clear and not tricky. Trude can make a technical class seem easy. She should teach math.
Better profs available for 220!

Was my first semester so no background knowledge. Tests were open book and quite fair. Assignments often went outside of material he had taught you so you had to teach yourself. Readings were smaller pieces of larger texts. Finding the larger texts online could often help for learning concepts relevant to assignments. Overall just a solid prof.

As other people mentioned here, the material was taught as if we already had some background knowledge on it, so I had to spend a lot of time outside class going over it. The grade distribution was not clear but I got B+ with ~80%. Tests were relatively easy compared to the homework and the amount of time I spent figuring the material out.
AVOID HIM TRUST

I've taken many ling courses and this = one of the most difficult due to lack of communication and clear instruction alone. He is very knowledgebale, 100%, but he assumes you know more than you do and doesn't offer much foundational help. Difficult to reach both prof and TAs out of class. Very, very frustrating tbh, feeling #abysmal sorry john

Not hard to get a good grade, but is very frustrating to learn under. He develops his own way of writing and doesn't explain what most of it means, leaving you to decipher his system on your own. Assumes that you already know far too much, especially for an intro Ling course.

Terrible professor. Yawns during his lecture and shows no interest in teaching the material as well as shows little care for seeing his students succeed. You ask him for help and he makes it seem like your question and concerns are invalid and pointless. I find this course to be interesting but would recommend with a different professor.

Lectures and lecture slides all over the map, so confusing. He goes WAY too fast, doesn't explain things clearly or thoroughly, and uses terminology that assumes prior knowledge. This is an INTRO course. He also jumps all over the text book instead of following it in a linear fashion to help build on knowledge. Seems like a nice enough guy though.

An extremely frustrating prof. Disorganized & complicated lectures that confuse students. I just read the text and skipped Lec cuz he's so boring and confusing. If I hadn't taken other LING courses before, I'd have been in trouble! Too hard for an Intro course. Makes tutorials a req and assigns homework. Totally killed my interest in LING! AVOID!!!
very good prof.!!

I cant believe people are saying Alderete is a good prof. I was interested in ling before I took this intro class, but now I just feel frustruated and lost because of John. In lec he uses terminology that is way too advanced for an intro class, and when he does pause to ask 'any questions' i dont even know where to begin. The tests are m/c but HARD
Easy course, learned a lot

Textbook online, and she tells you what parts to read. Pretty engaging lectures, and tutorials are a must go-to, since it is during tutorials that you learn how to do most of the concepts. Definitely ask questions in tutorial, she is super caring and will explain any question you have, no matter what it is. Great experience.

Accidentally took this class in my very first semester. Pretty easy. Loved her lectures. She explained things in a simple manner. Instructions for assignments were clear. Tutorials were extremely helpful. Be sure to read the textbook. Tests ranged between easy and average. Didn't have a midterm or final exam.

Skipped 70% of lectures and did fine. Her slides aren't the best, had to find other sources to learn how to do certain things, which was fairly easy. Do your assignments and make sure you know the material for the exam, and they're quite simple and easy to do well on. TA's were quite helpful too.

Her exams are stupidly hard and there's a bunch of group assignments so you better pray you get a good group
Her exams were a total pain and she was kinda strict but she was a nice person

Lectures were fine, easy enough, but group projects are her entire assignment method for this class and 160 which sucks. Tutorials are mandatory and annoying cuz the TA's have a power trip so no one likes to respond. Fairly good class if you're okay with cold calls in tutorials and just focus on the material yourself.

Eva is very good at teaching the introductory course; she keeps in mind that the amount of concepts covered can be confusing for non-linguistics students. Very warm and wants to help her students succeed. I didn't enjoy tutorials because the participation model was terrible/borderline humiliating, but it depends on the TA. Prof is wonderful though!
She is relatable and very enthusiastic when teaching linguistic course! Wonderful prof

Dr. Eva is awesome! She takes into consideration that since the course has no pre reqs, there are people in class with no LING background whatsoever. The course requires constant work, so do no fall behind! She directs her coursework in a way that in the end everything fits nicely into a puzzle. Would definitely take another LING course with her.

LOVED ALL HER CLASSES! Such a good teacher and very easy to understand. She explains things in a very unique yet easy way. Loved to do all her assignments but the exams are not that easy. Overall a 4/5. Would highly recommend anyone taking Linguistics.

eva is such a great prof! this was the first class of ling i ever took, and she made it a great experience. she's always available to help and answer questions. also super nice and approachable! is great at clarifying and going over examples to avoid confusion. definitely take a course with her if you can! exams were online; no final. [fall 2021]
Super nice, explains everything with examples that are rlly good. She makes such a great atmosphere in the classroom. If you ever have questions ASK THEM. she will 100% be able to cleaar ur doubts.
To anyone reading this review on this page, get off this page and look for another prof. to take a class with. You will regret taking this class. WORST. PROF. EVER.

Just finished ling220 with Dr Rimrott, got good score again! For students who has taken ling 110, this course is definitely a good choice. Lectures are attractive and interactive as usual, so does Annes great patience!

Anne gives tremendously engaging lectures, is accessible, and passionate about her field. However, some of the exams force students to really think outside some of the material. While I think that's admirable and ambitious, it feels risky for a 220 course if students haven't taken a previous LING course. Definitely take on all of the readings.
Anne is a very good prof.  Her grade scale and tests are fair and her lectures are engaging.

Anne is awesome! Took LING 100 with her and currently in her LING 220 class. She really does her best to make lectures interesting and understandable for everyone. Showing up to lectures are a must. Marking and tests are fair; some things will need extra review.

Anne is an awesome lecturer and I would definitely attend her lectures again if she does teach any other LING courses. There's group work for marks every lecture so even though she won't check attendance, you won't get the grades if you don't show up. Attend lecture to understand the course content better. Very nice and funny.

My favourite prof so far. 3 hour lectures breeze by because she's a really clear and engaging educator. Knows her stuff and is passionate about linguistics! Very approachable and kind. Provides a lot of material to help you succeed in her course and is quick to answer questions. You will learn a lot & have fun!

Amazing prof. She marked 100+ student assignments BY HERSELF during the TA job action . She is clear and knows her stuff, as well as making the class very multicultural. However, she puts in effort and expects it from students too, so weekly homework and test are quite tough, but doable if you study reasonably.

Anne clearly explained all concepts and was always available to give extra help.  her exams were completely unfair. Instead of  the final exam just testing the material learned, the questions were of a higher difficulty level than expected for an introductory course. I would not recommend this course unless exams are changed to be more fair.

Anne's interest in the subject is super high, she's hilarious, and absolutely amazing when it comes to explaining tough concepts. Couldn't have passed the class without her c: would 100% have her as a prof again

She's very nice, and she's passionate and knowledgeable about linguistics. Lecture slides are taken from the textbook, and she explains them in a way that makes the textbook almost unnecessary. The tests are fair if you PRACTICE applying the concepts a lot. She helps you practice during the lectures, so make sure to attend.
She has a great personality, and the class can be fun if you are in a small class.
Don't take  this class with her, you'll definitely regret it.
Interesting course

She seems like she'd be really nice, but for an introduction to a subject you need to leave a little leeway for misunderstandings. Her tests were way to hard given the material she was teaching and what was in the textbook, her slides and what she said. Not a fair grader. She wanted us to be upper level students not be novices.

I don't know why some of the reviews say the exams are hard... I thought they were pretty fair if you studied decently. Her lectures were clear enough that I didn't read the textbook. She's willing to help if you have any questions and is also receptive to feedback. Overall, I her class was pretty laid back and I enjoyed learning.
She was nice professor during class; she interacts with people. Lecture slides were pretty clear. The midterm was fair but the final was really hard.

Very organized prof but this class is NOT a GPA booster. What we learn in lecture is understandable but her assignments and exams are really HARD. She her self says no one can get an A in her class. You will learn quite a bit in her lecture as she is great at teaching but applying what you've learnt to the actual course work is difficult !
Final is very hard, and don't konw why

Lectures are clear and helpful, but exams are extremely hard compared to assignments and examples. She's receptive to feedback from students though. Interesting material but probably not a GPA booster.
Nice lady, fair assignments, impossible exams. Avoid.
stupid prof and final is so hard.

Class is very interesting and prof is OK.However, exams are extremely hard (class average for the final is even less than 55%), and the course grading scheme is very hard either, so even you are on average of the class, you are very likely to get a C or even C-... Not recommended to take it if Anne is teaching it because your GPA would drop

Horrible prof. Tells class that she hates getting emails from us. Extremely hard exams. Got A+'s on the 2 big assignments, yet barely managed to pass the midterm and final. DO NOT TAKE THIS COURSE WITH HER.

Exams are extremely hard. The concepts are straightforward but the questions she asks are ridiculous. All multiple choice questions for the midterm, but literally every answer could be correct. The grading scheme is extremely high as well and she does not curve the course. Overall I really disliked her as a prof and would avoid if possible

Really friendly and personable. The first midterm was really hard but a lot of the students talked to her and she changed it for the next one. The only thing I didn't like was the high grading system.

The content of this course was  straightforward but the Prof was mediocre. My main gripes with her come from  her lack of clarity when explaining new or confusing concepts, and her draconian grading system. 79-84 was a B- if I recall correctly. I scored a 75 in the class landing me a C+  much to my dismay. Subpar Prof; take course w/ someone else.

Midterm was deceptively easy compared to the final, a lot of people were taken by surprise as there seemed to be a lot more in detail questions and terminology than we covered in class.. frustrating to see such a style change from one exam to the next.. profs need to have some sense of consistency!

I had her for LING220 and thought she was wonderful! She can be a bit monotone, but I found her lectures helpful although her notes are quite broad. A lot of the other students in the class I talked with seemed to like her as well and found the course relatively easy. Assignments and midterm were easy, although the final was trickier.

There are only multiple choice questions on the midterm, and she said most people did well (I also found the midterm really easy). Assignments which have few questions are also easy. Overall, I would say this course is a GPA booster :) I liked her lectures, so didn't skip at all, but you can get all important information from the book.

LOVE DASHA WITH ALL MY HEART. She is an amazing TA, do anything to be taught by her. She makes confusing concepts easy and is always on her feet to help and explain with any questions. She is amazing at teaching and an amazing person. So kind and caring. I wish she taught all my courses. I look forward to classes with her and learning from her.

Had her as my TA for Ling 220 and I would totally recommend getting her as a TA. I will be for sure taking her courses when she teaches as she's really good at explaining even the toughest concepts. She makes herself available to her students and really good at communicating with her students!

Very easy. fun class. If you attend the lectures and do the assignments, and not study at all, you will end up having a C. If you study the chapters right before the test, you will easily get a B if not an A. Take it!
Fantastic Professor. Although the midterm/final/assignments were really easy, she went much further into detail in lecture. I definitely recommend this prof.
Great Professor
Truly a one of a kind prof who actually cares about her students

She is very nice and gives answer keys for assignments and the midterm which was helpful. Tutorials were awesome and helpful. The final was very much like the midterm format but heavy on syntax/morphology/semantics. She kind of talks fast in class, but her lectures are straightforward. Taking her for LING282W next term.
Very nice and always makes sure that you understand the material.

Dr. Bliss is an amazing professor who knows her subject well and is passionate about teaching to young minds. The grading was not too hard, I mostly had issues due to not being familiar with IPA (which you should learn before taking this class btw). Overall an amazing class and helped me to reignite my passion for linguistics.

Dr. Bliss is an awesome professor who is very knowledgeable about her field of work. The TA's in the class are super helpful, and along with Dr. Bliss try their best to help you understand many complex linguistic theories. It is definitely hard, but worth it if you are at all interested in learning linguistics. Pro Tip: learn IPA before class start

I took LING220 and 282W back in Fall 2019 and Spring 2020. Irina was the TA for both courses, and she was BRILLIANT. She communicated really well between the professor and the students. She was always enthusiastic, and always down to answer questions. She was a fair marker, and gave helpful feedback on written assignments. Thanks Irina! :)
